items.content:
Welcome ladies, gentlemen, and other marvelous people!

Our topic of the day is the present perfect!

On this website you can find:

  • Explanation
  • Exercises
  • Recap
  • Test

At the end of this lesson:

  • You know how to make the present perfect
  • You can tell me something about a recent experience

We use the present perfect to:

  • Say that something started in the past and is still going on now.
    E.g. "She has lived there since 2011."
  • Talk about experiences
    E.g. "They have never been outside of Europe."
  • Say that something happened it the past and you can still see the result(s)
    E.g. "I have washed the bike so now it shines again."

prompt.body: Mix the sentence with the reason why we use the present perfect.

content.body: Talk about experiences
Say that something happened it the past and you can still see the result(s)
Say that something started in the past and is still going on now
My friends have known each other for 10 months.
He has visited Japan once.
I have worked for too long. I am exhausted!
Good job!
• Almost there! Check when "we use the present perfect" again.

items.content:
The reasons we want to learn this:

- So we make the teacher happy

- To talk to family or friends in another country

- To talk to people you meet when traveling

- To talk to people who visit your country

- To pass the test

- To scream correctly to people while gaming, or just to talk correctly to people online.

How do we make the present perfect?

  • Have/has + -ed
    E.g. I have played basketball for seven years.
    Play = Played
  • To be + 3rd row (irregular verbs: see textbook)
    E.g. I have won the tournament! Look at my medal
    Win = won

content.body:
1. I played Call of Duty since it was released.
  2. You won it all!
  3. He cleaned the living room. The house looks so clean!
  4. She kicked the ball too far.
  5. It stopped since yesterday.
  6. We planned this for months now!
  7. You done enough for today.
  8. They not done enough yet.
That is correct!
So close! What was the rule again?

items.content:
If you see any of the F.Y.N.E.J.A.S words in a sentence. Remember the present perfect.
IT CAN SAVE YOUR LIFE!

  • For
  • Yet
  • Never
  • Ever
  • Just
  • Already
  • Since

content.body:
Pick out all the signal words for the present perfect.

It has shown me the answer for as long as I can remember. The reason I have never seen it is because I have never paid attention. She has told me what it was ever since she knew I had no idea what the answer was.
Bravo! You have a keen eye!
Ahhh, close to perfect! Remember FYNEJAS.

items.content:
It is very important to keep up with your vocabulary. Otherwise the grammar has very little effect!
You also need it for the coming test.
The app below will help you study the words in a fun and effective way!


P.S.
Try to beat my highscore in the mix and match

content.body:
Select all the signal words of the present perfect.
Not all sentences need to have one!

  1. ​Koda the bear has eaten all the fish, now he is really sleepy!
  2. They have already told me the truth.
  3. The twins have lived in this town for 23 years now.
  4. We have had a parrot since I can remember.
  5. My name is mister Muller. We haven't met yet!
  6. Oh no! It must have broken the lamp!
  7. I've never run a marathon so my feet have big blisters now.
  8. She has just finished the match in first place!
  9. For almost four weeks I have worked as a manager.
KAPOW! You rock!
Come on, you know this! Read the FYNEJAS examples again!

Select the present perfect.

  1. ​Koda the bear has eaten all the fish, now he is really sleepy!
  2. They have already told me the truth.
  3. The twins have lived in this town for 23 years now.
  4. We have had a parrot since I can remember.
  5. My name is mister Muller. We haven't met yet!
  6. Oh no! It must have broken the lamp!
  7. I've never run a marathon so my feet have big blisters now.
  8. She has just finished the match in first place!
  9. For almost four weeks I have worked as a manager.
WOWZA! KAWABUNGA! On to the next one champ!
So close!! This one was really tricky. Maybe try the "How?" explanation again?

Damon: Hey Ellie! How are you? It (1) (be) a long time since I ran into you!

Ellie: I am doing quite alright! How is your dad doing now? I heard he (2) (fall) ill!

Damon: He is alright. I am on my way to him now. The surgeons (3) just (finish) the surgery.

Ellie: Hopefully it was a success!

Damon: It was just a minor problem. His previous wounds (4) (heal) perfectly. Now it's only the other side. So the result should be the same.

Ellie: Oh, that is a relief! Have you heard about Jason's arrest?

Damon: His arrest?

Ellie: Yes he really (5) (chose) the wrong career. Being a criminal never pays off!

Damon: I should (6) (know) when I first saw him break the law! He really liked doing it.

Ellie: Unless he admits he has a problem, he will never be straight.

Damon: I absolutely agree!

Ellie: Well, I (7) (be) out since noon. I should get home now!

Damon: Good idea! My mom (8) (wait) for the surgery to be over since that time too. She must be tired!

Ellie: The best wishes to your dad! Such a pleasure to see you again! See you around.

Damon: Bye Ellie. See you!

Best of luck!

With this assignment you can score an extra 0,5 points on the test!

Each correct question earns you 0,1 points extra.
Do not cheat! I can see if you copied a sentence! So look at the sentences made and make sure they are not the same.
